debug.text: Contains debug information that may be included in the response.

result.text: Provides the result of async recognition

session.text: Base info for the established async session.

meta.description: Needs to be implemented by the user of the API on a URL of your choice.

debug.text: Contains debug information that may be included in the response.

result.text: Full, i.e. non-incremental, results of transcription. The following fields should always be present:

session.text: Base info for the established async session.

progress.text: Provides information about the progress of processing. Either incremental or full depending on the context.

responseType.text: Whether the result is incremental or full

audioCallback.text: Present whenever the OFFLINE transcription session was started with the audio callback option and the source audio was provided from URL.

meta.description: Needs to be implemented by the user of the API on a URL of your choice.

ani.text: (only if session originated over phone) Caller phone number or sip address

sid.text: AIVR session id on Voicegain platform

dnis.text: (only if session originated over phone) Called phone number or sip address

vars.text: (optional) Map with variables to initiate the new session.

sequence.text: sequential number within session of this callback or websocket message

aivrAppId.text: AIVR application id on Voicegain platform

authToken.text: Unique token that can be used to authenticate session related API requests outside of the callback or websocket. The token is valid while a session is in progress plus 5 minutes.

startTime.text: Start time of the AIVR session

userAppData.text: (optional) App specific data that was associated in the AIVR portal with this AIVR number/application.

defaultVoice.text: Default TTS voice that will be used for this call unless overridden by the callback responses.

toBeTranscribed.text: Whether this call is to have a transcript.

callIsBeingRecorded.text: Whether this call is being recorded.

estimatedQueueWaitSeconds.text: Estimated Queue Wait range in seconds

meta.description: Specification of a callback method that invoked by the Voicegain Platform to indicate a start of a new Telephony Bot session to the User's dialog control logic.

vars.text: Map with user reponses collected during this AIVR session.

events.text: List of AIVR events that occurred since last callback

limit.text: set the maximum number of returned results

detailed.text: If true then detailed results will be returned including per channel data. Set to false if you need the results for just the table of available results w/o detail.

contextId.text: Context Id. Only needed if making a request without JWT but using MAC Access Authentication instead.

fromAllContexts.text: If true then results from all contexts will be retrieved

meta.description: Get Speech Analytics data that matches filters.

asr.text: ASR setting suitable for transcription for Speech Analytics.

tags.text: Tags associated with the Speech Analytics session. Each tag is a string with max length of 64 characters.

audio.text: Defines audio input for transcription or recognition. Note that not all audio sources are suitable for various async modes. Here are the modes supported by various audio input:

label.text: Label to assign to the Speech Analytics session. May be displayed in a table to make identifying a session easier.

creator.text: (optional) Id of the user who starts this Speech Analytics session. If invoked from Web UI then we will use identity of the logged-in user.

persist.text: Time (in msec) to retain the result data after processing has completed. Data can be retained indefinitely if value is -1. As long as the persist has not expired the data will be available.

metadata.text: Metadata passed with the request to async transcription, recognition, or Speech Analytics. Consist of a list of named string values. Names in the list have to be unique. If duplicates are provided then only the last one will be retained.

saConfig.text: id of the Speech Analytics configuration to use. If not provided then default SA Config for the context will be used.

speakerchannels.text: For stereo audio this is used to map audio channels to processing sessions and to identify which one is Agent.

callReviewConfig.text: (optional) id of the Call Review (Score Card) configuration to use. The Call Review Config will be used to guide the generation of autopopulated Call Review Answers.

notifyStompTopic.text: (optional) STOMP Topic name - if present then the entire POST /sa response will be sent over websocket to the specified STOMP topic.

topicDiscoveryConfig.text: (optional) id of the Topic Discovery configuration to use. If not provided then default Topic Discovery Config for the context will be used.

virtualDualChannelEnabled.text: Applies only if the source audio is mono (1 channel). This is intended to be used in cases where we want to process a call center call that was recorded in mono.

meta.description: Create and launch new Speech Analytics Session.

audio.text: If true then original or simulated (if diarization was used) multichannel (stereo) audio will be returned.

emotion.text: If true then emotion (mood and sentiment) information will be returned

phrases.text: If true then phrases spotted in the text will be returned

summary.text: If true then summary data for the transcript will be returned

criteria.text: If true then criteria satisfied in the text will be returned

decibels.text: If this parameter has a value then the result will contain an array of decibel values for the audio data.

entities.text: If true then named entities spotted in the text will be returned

keywords.text: If true then keywords spotted in the text will be returned

incidents.text: If true then list of incidents (silence, overtalk) identified in the call will be returned

wordCloud.text: If true then word cloud data for the transcript will be returned

audioZones.text: If true then audioZones information will be returned

meta.description: Retrieve Speech Analytics result data.

list.phrase: My goal was to provide you with an excellent customer service. Did I do that for you today? yes

components.phrase: My goal was to provide you with an excellent customer service. Did I do that for you today? yes

meta.description: Get status of given speech-analytics session

width.text: Applicable only to captions. Determines max caption width in number of characters.

format.text: Specifies the format of the transcript to be returned. Valid values are:

interval.text: Applicable only to plain text transcript. Determines interval (in seconds) between time stamps.

meta.description: Retrieve transcript from Speech Analytics session (after transcription is complete) in one of several possible formats.

name.text: Name to match. If the provided name ends with a star * then a prefix match will be performed.

type.text: Speech Analytics Configuration Type - user, built-in, or any (any is a union of user and built-in)

contextId.text: Context Id. Only needed if making a request without JWT but using MAC Access Authentication instead.

inclOtherContextPublished.text: If true then will also retrieve Speech Analytics Configurations from other contexts on this account which have been published.

name.text: Name to match. If the provided name ends with a star * then a prefix match will be performed.

type.text: Speech Analytics Configuration Type - user, built-in, or any (any is a union of user and built-in)

contextId.text: Context Id. Only needed if making a request without JWT but using MAC Access Authentication instead.

inclOtherContextPublished.text: If true then will also retrieve Speech Analytics Configurations from other contexts on this account which have been published.

meta.description: Create new Speech Analytics Configuration

meta.description: Get Speech Analytics configuration for given id.

response_format.name: Auto-Insurance-SA-Conf

examples.sentence: Was I able to resolve your concerns up to your satisfaction today?

response_format.llmSummaryPrompt: Generate a one-sentence summary of the call.
response_format.llmCopilotNotesPrompt: Generate brief notes for the record of this call in the CRM.

age.text: (future functionality) Set to true to enable speaker age estimation

gender.text: (not available for real-time mode yet) Set to true to enable voice gender classifcation

keyword.text: Configuration that specifies keywords to be detected. The keyword detection algorithm uses text matching with simple text manipulations like e.g. stemming.

criteria.text: Criteria to be detected Each Criterion cofiguration contains a list of SubCriteria that need to be satisfied. All SubCriteria within the list must be satisfied for the list to return true.

entities.text: Selection of Named Entity types to detect.

contextId.text: (Needed only if making a request using MAC Authentication. Otherwise will be taken from JWT.)

phraseGroup.text: Group of phrases/intents. Can be used to detect combinations of phrases in the caller.

keywordGroup.text: Keyword groups - Group tags must be different from the tags used for keywords. One use for keyword groups is that the GET /sa/call-stats API supports reporting stats of keywords within a Group.

meetingMinutes.text: Controls the generation of the Meeting minutes.

callResolutionCriteria.text: (beta) list of tags of the Criteria used to determine if the call was resolved. If any of these criteria are satisfied then the call will be considered as resolved.

competitorKeywordGroups.text: (internal use - for Speech Analytics UI) Set of one or more keyword group tags that should be interpreted as identifying competitor mentions.

callResolutionQuestionId.text: (beta) id of the crQuestionId in Call Review that identifies question and answer regarding Call Resolution

overtalkTotalPercentageThreshold.text: Percentage-based threshold used to determine if an overtalk incident has occured. Applies to total overtalk expressed as percentage of the call duration.

overtalkSingleDurationMaximumThreshold.text: Duration-based threshold (in milliseconds) used to determine if an overtalk incident has occured. Applies to maximun duration of single/individual cases of overtalk.

meta.description: Modify existing Speech Analytics Configuration.

gender.text: (not available for real-time mode yet) Set to true to enable voice gender classifcation

keyword.text: Configuration that specifies keywords to be detected. The keyword detection algorithm uses text matching with simple text manipulations like e.g. stemming.

criteria.text: Criteria to be detected Each Criterion cofiguration contains a list of SubCriteria that need to be satisfied. All SubCriteria within the list must be satisfied for the list to return true.

entities.text: Selection of Named Entity types to detect.

contextId.text: (Needed only if making a request using MAC Authentication. Otherwise will be taken from JWT.)

phraseGroup.text: Group of phrases/intents. Can be used to detect combinations of phrases in the caller.

keywordGroup.text: Keyword groups - Group tags must be different from the tags used for keywords. One use for keyword groups is that the GET /sa/call-stats API supports reporting stats of keywords within a Group.

callResolutionCriteria.text: (beta) list of tags of the Criteria used to determine if the call was resolved. If any of these criteria are satisfied then the call will be considered as resolved.

competitorKeywordGroups.text: (internal use - for Speech Analytics UI) Set of one or more keyword group tags that should be interpreted as identifying competitor mentions.

callResolutionQuestionId.text: (beta) id of the crQuestionId in Call Review that identifies question and answer regarding Call Resolution

overtalkTotalPercentageThreshold.text: Percentage-based threshold used to determine if an overtalk incident has occured. Applies to total overtalk expressed as percentage of the call duration.

overtalkSingleDurationMaximumThreshold.text: Duration-based threshold (in milliseconds) used to determine if an overtalk incident has occured. Applies to maximun duration of single/individual cases of overtalk.
